params._arbitrator: The arbitrator to rule on created disputes.
params._metaEvidence: The URI of the meta evidence object for evidence submissions requests.

createDispute(uint256,bytes,uint256,uint.details: TRUSTED. Calls createDispute function of the specified arbitrator to create a dispute. Note that we don’t need to check that msg.value is enough to pay arbitration fees as it’s the responsibility of the arbitrator contract.

params._evidenceGroupID: Unique identifier of the evidence group that is linked to this dispute.
params._feeInWeth: Amount of fees in WETH for the arbitrator.
params._numberOfRulingOptions: Number of ruling options. Must be greater than 1, otherwise there is nothing to choose from.

returns.disputeID: Dispute id (on arbitrator side) of the dispute created.

rule(uint256,uint256).details: To be called by the arbitrator of the dispute, to declare the winning ruling.

params._externalDisputeID: ID of the dispute in arbitrator contract.
params._ruling: The ruling choice of the arbitration.

devdoc.title: ArbitrableExample  An example of an arbitrable contract which connects to the arbitator that implements the updated interface.
